item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 1

material.mattext: An IDPS consists of a single device that you install between your firewall and the Internet.

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 2

material.mattext: A weakness of a signature-based system is that it must keep state information on a possible attack.

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 3

material.mattext: No actual traffic passes through a passive sensor; it only monitors copies of the traffic.

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 4

material.mattext: An NIDPS can tell you whether an attack attempt on the host was successful.

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 5

material.mattext: A hybrid IDPS combines aspects of NIDPS and HIDPS configurations.

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 6

material.mattext: Which of the following is NOT a network defense function found in intrusion detection and prevention systems?

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 7

material.mattext: Which of the following is NOT a primary detection methodology?

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 8

material.mattext: The period of time during which an IDPS monitors network traffic to observe what constitutes normal network behavior is referred to as which of the following?

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 9

material.mattext: What is an advantage of the anomaly detection method?
makes use of signatures of well-known attacks
system can detect attacks from inside the network by people with stolen accounts c. easy to understand and less difficult to configure than a signature-based system
after installation, the IDPS is trained for several days or weeks

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 10

material.mattext: Which approach to stateful protocol analysis involves detection of the protocol in use, followed by activation of analyzers that can identify applications not using standard ports?

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 11

material.mattext: Which of the following is an advantage of a signature-based detection system?
the definition of what constitutes normal traffic changes
it is based on profiles the administrator creates
each signature is assigned a number and name
the IDPS must be trained for weeks

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 12

material.mattext: Which method for detecting certain types of attacks uses an algorithm to detect suspicious traffic, is resource intensive, and requires extensive tuning and maintenance?

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 13

material.mattext: Which of the following is NOT a typical IDPS component?

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 14

material.mattext: Where is a host-based IDPS agent typically placed?
between remote users and internal network

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 15

material.mattext: Which IDPS customization option is a list of entities known to be harmless?

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 16

material.mattext: Which of the following is considered a problem with a passive, signature-based system?

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 17

material.mattext: Which type of IDPS can have the problem of getting disparate systems to work in a coordinated fashion?

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 18

material.mattext: Which of the following is NOT a method used by passive sensors to monitor traffic?

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 19

material.mattext: Which of the following is a sensor type that uses bandwidth throttling and alters malicious content?

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 20

material.mattext: Which of the following is true about an HIDPS?
sniffs packets as they enter the network

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 21

material.mattext: Which of the following is true about an NIDPS versus an HIDPS?
an NIDPS can determine if a host attack was successful
an HIDPS can detect attacks not caught by an NIDPS
an HIDPS can detect intrusion attempts on the entire network
an NIDPS can compare audit log records

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 22

material.mattext: Which of the following is an IDPS security best practice?
to prevent false positives, only test the IDPS at initial configuration
communication between IDPS components should be encrypted
all sensors should be assigned IP addresses
log files for HIDPSs should be kept local

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 23

material.mattext: If you see a /16 in the header of a snort rule, what does it mean?
a maximum of 16 log entries should be kept
the size of the log file is 16 MB
the detected signature is 16 bits in length

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 24

material.mattext: Why might you want to allow extra time for setting up the database in an anomaly-based system?
the installation procedure is usually complex and time consuming
to add your own custom rule base
it requires special hardware that must be custom built
to allow a baseline of data to be compiled

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 25

material.mattext: Which of the following is true about the steps in setting up and using an IDPS?
anomaly-based systems come with a database of attack signatures
sensors placed on network segments will always capture every packet
alerts are sent when a packet doesnt match a stored signature
false positives do not compromise network security

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 26

material.mattext: Anomaly detection systems make use of _______________ that describe the services and resources each authorized user or group normally accesses on the network.

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 27

material.mattext: In a _______________ based detection system, the IDPS can begin working immediately after installation.

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 28

material.mattext: An IDPS __________________ server is the central repository for sensor and agent data.

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 29

material.mattext: A network ____________ is a type of passive sensor that consists of a direct connection between a sensor and the physical network medium.

item.title: CH-8 Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems 30

material.mattext: __________________ procedures are a set of actions that are spelled out in the security policy and followed if the IDPS detects a true positive.
